Class TwoDArraysUtility

Object
TwoDArraysUtility
public class TwoDArraysUtility extends Object
Contains our two utility functions for this Connect4 app, play() and checkForWin().

    • TwoDArraysUtility

  • Method Details

    • play

      public boolean play(int player, int column, int[][] board)
      This method takes three parameters and uses them to play a piece on the Connect4 board. It returns a boolean value based upon whether the piece was able to played in the column. This method should be constructed to check the "bottom" row in the specified the column. Start by checking the sixth row of your "board". If the row/column set you are checking does not contain a 0, ascend a row in the "board" and check if a 0 is contained in the above row. Repeat these steps until you ascend all rows in the given column or until a non-zero piece is found. Whenever you discover a row/column set that contains a zero, you should replace it with the player number and then return true, modifying our board parameter also modifies the board back in the calling method. If the entire row is ascended and no zeros are found, return a false value. Keep in mind that the entire 2D Array is initialized to 0 values, and that Arrays are also 0-based.
      Parameters:
      player - The number of the current player, should always be 1 or 2.
      column - The column selected by the current player, must be 1-7.
      Returns:
      True if piece was played, False if column selected was full.

    • checkForWin

      public int checkForWin(int[][] board)
      This method will be run after each placement of a piece. It will check for all possible victories of either player and not just the player who just went. A victory is achieved when 4 of the same piece are lined up. This can be diagonally, vertically, or horizontally. This may seem like a large sum of code, but nested for-loops can make it possible to not exceed 20 lines for the whole method. One nested for-loop can check one way a victory is achieved. In total, three nested for loops can check each of the three ways a victory is achieved.
      Parameters:
      board - This is the board to check for each players victory.
      Returns:
      Returns the value of whichever player has won, return 0 if no player has won.
